title: Freeman Dyson
summary: Freeman John Dyson FRS (15 December 1923 – 28 February 2020)[2] was an British-American theoretical physicist and mathematician known for his works in quantum field theory, astrophysics, random matrices, mathematical formulation of quantum mechanics, condensed matter physics, nuclear physics, and engineering.[lower-alpha 1][7] He was Professor Emeritus in the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton and a member of the Board of Sponsors of the Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists.[8]
